Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Coming back to this awful excuse for a Battlefield trailer after watching the Pacific trailer is like I'm looking at separate games. One trailer is like a terrible mix of Battlefield Bad Company/Heros/BF1942 and the other is like if DICE had actually done a proper WWII Battlefield game. And one trailer still to this day makes me cringe and the other actually gets me in the mood to play BFV.


Whomever is doing these new trailers needs to keep doing what they do best. DICE needs to knock it out of the park with chapter 5 and later chapters if they hope to gain any more players and keep them from moving on to the new games coming out (such as the new Modern Warfare).

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment: From all of the incredible heroics of WW2 (from men, women, whites, blacks and whatever) - you chose to go for some half-assed make-believe crap that is neither deep or interesting. Complete garbage of a campaign. I am saddened that incredible and talented developers spent thousands of hours (especially during crunch time) polishing this turd of a campaign. If you want to show more sides of WW2 don't make stupid things up - use reality. Reality is a way better story teller than this abomination. I hope DICE goes independent so they can make a good game that is not bound by the stupid antics of EA's management.

Main problems:

And, of course, Ms. Handicapped

I remember being really excited for this game and when I finally got the game and played it I was like ‚ÄúThis game sucks.‚Äù I tried to play it again, still ‚ÄúThis game sucks.‚Äù I liked Battlefront 1, but I said ‚ÄúThis game sucks‚Äù with Battlefront 2. It is amazing how much money EA wants from us and how it‚Äôs ruining such great franchises. Battlefield for the most part has been great, Battlefront was good and EA messed it up. Especially with Battlefront.

The Sims is even worse. So many expansion packs that cost (from how much gets added into the game) $5-$30. And I play the Sims a whole lot and when you have to pay $30 for a ‚Äúseasons pack‚Äù it gets ridiculous.

I always thought the EA is greedy thing funny because I thought their games were good. But I was wrong. I feel so bad for the people that pay $70 for a new player in FIFA or something.

This is really the first BF that i don't enjoy that much playing
I come back weekly just for tides of war and some conquest but after 7 months i'm tired of the same maps, bad operations and modes that go back and forth

I spent 30 bucks for the game but i have the least amount of hours played and at the moment i wouldn't suggest it to someone

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment: Good to all, the truth is I'm a user who has been playing the saga for a long time, and I think that the talks I have with friends who are also fans of this franchise, there are things that DICE or EA should change, because they are sending this saga to failure. Beyond the fact that I do not have the numbers, nor the sales data and maybe that will take away relevance in my opinion, I feel that Battlefield is gradually becoming a game that is losing weight in the scene. The problems are multiple for me, but some that can be solved, are things that should not take, in principle a lot of work. Simple things that can improve the experience of the game and the community: I know that many people complained about Battlelog, but the truth was something that gave life to the community, to publish videos that we did, or publish things, such as contests, Raffles or whatever the big clans did, like in the clan that I was, CAHOS GAMING. I should return that platform. Another important thing is the issue of the plugin, before there was an almost total domain of private servers, you could do many things which, for the PC community, gave us that we have servers with their own characteristics, which gave personality to which we got, with different rules that the admin put and changed the game experience. Example: That you could not use fragmentation grains in Metro. If we go to something very impose is the issue of servers, maybe it is my filter problem, but at the most I see 6 servers, few, and they are not full at times. Also the rotations of them, could not separate them? This is a matter of taste but Hamada or Panzerstorm, giant maps, but even the first, with too many tickets, they become boring and people leave. Following with the servers the way to look for them is totally un-comfortable and not very intuitive, it would seem that the game is designed for something casual, to put looking for game and ready, as if it was oriented to a game of consoles, and that is not done. PC players do not have to fall into this, they do not have to treat us like this, because if even after so many years is still fairly alive the Battlefield 3 or 4 is for the PC players. Voice communication, I would like to be able to talk to other players of the team, the truth is that only talking with the patrol is not very funny, there should be a system where patrol leaders speak with others, this is so simple and could give another gameplay to the title that for me summarizes a lot. The problem of the Bugs or some things badly thought: - It costs a lot to build patrols outside the game to get to play with friends, they should correct this. - That you can not go from team to team, I find this limitation horrifying. - There is no autobalance. - Modifying weapons and personalization is uncomfortable. - The visibility of the game is bad, they need to clarify it, it has too much contrast and darkness, on the map Fjell 652 it looks better when there is a snow storm than how much is the sun - That the stats of the weapons and the classes favor the people who she is crouching championing her (the famous carpet mode). - Problem of vision - - The areas of collisions, is very bad, the bullets remain in mountains or surfaces that make me remember the BF 3. - The boring amount of missions to unlock things. - How long it takes to revive or how it is bugea sometimes, as if it were lageado. - The problem of the arms of the doctor, please, all weapons with the same statistics? just kidding? It does not make sense, they have to stop nerfing the doctor and put different weapons. This, I think, are some very simple things to change that could improve the title experience too much. Things that make the game I do not like: This is already a critique of the total game, the truth from the BF 4 I feel that it is getting worse and worse. It all started when the speed of the character's movement increased, it seems as if the infantry had been reduced in severity, vehicles, everything, the physics of the BF 3 were perfect, the player felt as heavy as the vehicles, I do not know why they left towards a faster game trend. Error. The level design is horrible, it's chaotic, meaningless, with few structures, too many open-air areas, the BF 1 suffered a lot from this, here there is a change in design, but it does not work with the style of play that is . It's an Arcade with realistic maps, and that does not work for me. These scenarios would serve for mechanics such as those of PUBG, that style of games, slow, with more damage in weapons, etc. Now you run super fast, you do things as if you were flash but when it comes to getting into a vehicle late, when it comes to reviving late, when it comes to late weapons charges, then? I say what it is like? So they make a map with "realistic" dyes and then put slow game mechanics as if it were a simulator? or are arcade in everything and try to look like a weapon, decide. The number of players, we are in 2019, how long have you been playing with 64 slot players? Is not it time for an evolution? to put more players? before it was a surprise factor the number of players in a game of BF, now is something that already seems outdated. As he throws the grenades, very fast, he feels ugly and as if it were an Indie game. The speed of how the soldier is thrown to the ground, super fanciful. As they run, it seems to me that there are many movements and animations like deaths that are great, but how the avatars move or run is rare, it seems generic, I do not know, as I said above, it gives me an impression of Indie game. The feeling of shooting, in the BF 3 or earlier was much better, now you feel that you shoot with equal weapons, that they do not have the weight or the rumble they should have. In itself there are many criticizable things, and many that do well but I do not want to make this post very long, I just want to say, of a more personal opinion, that they are loading into the saga and the truth has taken a path that does not like much people, not only me, it would be nice to go back to take things from BF 2, BF 3 or even the BF 4. I, and I think many, we wish that once and for all a saga so important for the FPS becomes competitive, for that they have to think about many things, and today, as long ago, the mechanics, the ways of playing these last battlfield seem designed to play 1, 2 or 3 games and nothing else, it is very casual, and we do not want that, we want tournaments, we want competitive classes to be generated and for that they have to give a screw-up to many things they have been doing wrong. Not only would the community win, but you would do it yourself (EA) if you would manage to position a Battlefield as an eSport. Greetings.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment: Coming back to the comments section of BF5 and BF1 I just realized how little people know about history and the facts. For example in BF1 people complained about a black German soldier not realizing that Germany had African colonies in Africa and Asia. That sometime shared the same uniform as the European German army.  In BF1 the main issue was a disabled British soldier if it being a woman or not was an issue for some but I wont include it because its tired. But the British SOE under Churchill recruited Men, Women, and the disabled for missions behind enemy lines and sometimes linked up with and fought beside regular infantry although that wasnt common it still happened. No matter if NoT aLoT oF tHeM fAuGht they still gave up their lives and served so they should be honored without question while yes how EA handled it was a shitshow for the most part the people that faught are pretty accurate.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
I have an idea for the next battlefield game-"Battlefield: Korea." Set during the 1950-1953 Korean War, the game will explore the war from all sides-US, South Korea, North Korea, China, and other various forces of UN and Soviet Russia.
UN/US/ROK Army guns
-WW2 Allied Leftover guns
+Reising M50, M3 Sniper, Ithaca M37, MAT-49 SMG, Bazooka Recoilless Cannon, and more!
CH/USSR/NK Army guns
-WW2 Soviet leftovers
+RPD, DP28, AK47 Type 1, SKS, Taiwanese Type 24, PTRD-41 and more!
Rule the ground with Russian and American tanks and vehicles(Willy Jeep included), and take the fight to the air in newly-developed 50s era Jet fighters and traditional propeller fighters!
The unforgiving Korean land is indifferent to soldiers suffering-experience a wide range of terrain, from wide-open harbors and city/village streets, to steep mountains and icy rivers!
The fate of the peninsula depends on you! Join the battle, today!

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment: I was really impressed with many of the anti-war tropes from Battlefield 1, such as how it would show the names of soldiers after they died and their hatred for the conflict. I have been out of the gaming world for some time now and am looking for a good excuse to pick up the controller again. In future projects I hope y'all are willing to concider games that deal with the realities of war in combination with things that align with the current times. Do many of the same things that were done in Battlefield 1, but go much more heavy on the war sentiment, like reliving the My Lai massacre, the shooting of Kent State, Hard Hat riots, and the horrors of Hamburger Hill.

today is 17/01/2019, I'm still grad my friend didn't buy me this game for my new year gift, even i can see DICE makes some big changes on new trailers, but deep in my mind it just does not worth it.
don't take me wrong, i'm a big fans of BF franchise, i own all BF games since BF-1942. i really really really want to play it now, even i know the PUNK uniform customization and front line female soldiers make me sick, but it is still a good game (not perfect, not what it should be).
so the reason i'm still holding my wallet is my PRIDE, a pride of BF fans!
i wish i can personally teach EA a lesson by not buying this game, this lesson is for your DISRESPECTFUL to the history, ARROGANT behavior to your fans and IRRESPONSIBLE  for the BF franchise. 
my contribution maybe very tiny but i believe i'm not alone,  if we all do this EA will remember this lesson forever, and the future  BF games will become great again.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
The war story ‚ÄúNordlys‚Äù is historically accurate with the exception of one tiny detail: it wasn‚Äôt a mother-daughter resistance team, it was a group of all male Norwegian commandos.  ‚ÄúUnder No Flag‚Äù is bad comedy.  The only accurate parts about ‚ÄúTirailleur‚Äù is that French Colonial troops did play a role on the European battlefield (though minor) and they were left out of the history books.  The only truly 100% historically accurate war story is ‚ÄúThe Last Tiger‚Äù, for which I congratulate DICE, as it is a beautiful story that shows a point of view that isn‚Äôt often shown, and they showed the inner conflict of German soldiers between their duty to the F√ºhrer and the reality around them as the Reich collapsed.  Another reason ‚ÄúThe Last Tiger‚Äù is the best war story is because it shows that there were good people who just ended up on the losing side, showed that the only ones who were willing to fight to the bitter end were brainwashed kids who had never seen battle.  As for multiplayer, tanks and the medic class need serious buffs.  As an assault, I‚Äôve destroyed multiple tigers and churchills on my own in seconds.  As a medic, I severely lack firepower to defend myself.  The bolt action rifles all require 2 shots to kill unless you can somehow land a headshot.  The medium machine guns have no accuracy whatsoever, and the bipod mechanic needs improvement.  Overall, this game feels like it was rushed in order to get it to market before the end of the year.  Add that to EA‚Äôs disastrous marketing of the game, and it‚Äôs set to be one of the worst games of the year.  I will however give DICE and EA the hope that changes will be made.  Elder Scrolls Online and Battlefield 1 weren‚Äôt the greatest when they came out, but I love them both now.  I hope this game doesn‚Äôt become the next Mass Effect Andromeda: despised and, eventually, forgotten and lost to history.

Just my personal opinions.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Only reason I own it is because they have it for half off now ($30) and the don't do returns for online payments.    
Spending most of my teenaged years infatuated with the series since battlefield: 1942, it only took one round and a handful of deaths to confirm this game truly is broken and most likely irepairable. feels like COD but manages to find a way to play even worse. Many things factored in that were apparently genius to the developers had no real value in gameplay. For example, the revive system they have brought in puts everyone in a down but not out state, and theres slim to non chance you will ever receive a revive regardless. I decided against the classic, two stars and a wish, or compliment sandwich, as there is only one compliment I will give them that I've seen been carried through the series which is there graphics. The visuals have so much potential, but unfortunately we may never see it in an EA title.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Hey Battlefield, wasn't this trailer supposed to bring in NEW people ?

You basically put up a big middle finger to your core fanbase, in order to attract a bigger and newer fanbase. People that don't even play your game, or play video games for that matter.

The intention didn't pay off though. Battlefield 1 is still the best selling game in the franchise, and that one was a bold and unique move to WWI.

This is just a failure of trailer, didn't do anything other than hurt your franchise in the long run. Thousands upon thousands will never be even slightly interest in Battlefield V now, because you felt the need to be so all inclusive, in a really agressive way, and push out so many fans. Shame, because BF V is a great game, just shy of BF 1's greatness, but it'll become destroyed by microtransactions now, and will never get the sort of post launch suppor that Battlefield 1 had gotten.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
People play WWII and other historically-themed games for the immersion-factor... to feel as if they are taking part of a moment in history.
The only women in combat roles for the British military were women who volunteered for anti-aircraft batteries (in England). Yes, they were credited with shooting down V-1 rockets, but nowhere did they enter the European theater to fight as part of a British squad - not even as a special forces-type of soldier... and the immersion-breaking factor is you have her in this game missing an arm. I am a disabled Army veteran. I KNOW that there is no way in H.E-double hockey sticks that a woman who lost her arm, had time to recover, have a futuristic prosthetic (more than a simple lever "hand") attached, gone through physical rehabilitation and exercise... no way would she ever be sent near a combat unit in the 1940s (even today, there are only a handful of people with prosthetic limbs serving active duty - none in combat roles, for that would put able-bodied soldiers at risk).
Your attempt to make an all-inclusive game are noble... IF it were NOT a HISTORICALLY-BASED genre! I could have been fine with having a woman combat soldier (even though it is 100% historically incorrect), but having her ALSO have a prosthetic arm? Nope, that's pushing the believability factor out the window.
I'm a bit late on getting around to video games due to my physical disability. I JUST started playing Fallout 4 two months ago... As I watched the trailer, I was thinking "I hope the control buttons are intuitive or I won't be able to push the buttons" (again, duet o my disability)... then I see the scene where this British soldier woman saves the dude... okay, there's a woman on a British combat team... wait? Is she missing an arm and has a prosthetic? Nope! Immersion broken, I'll prefer the messed-up Fallout 76 over some "woke" BS. 
Why not add to your game a Rainbow Pride flag while you're at it?

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Actually just a shame... Used to like battlefield but after this dumpster fire prolly won't ever pick up another 1. Does such a huge dis service to the actual history of the horrors of WWII. Hell I just watched a documentary of a US serviceman who won the medal of honor in WWII who was black. AND his race is very important bc at the time blacks were beginning to be integrated into the military and he knew in order for them to receive the praise and notice they deserved it had to be earned. Their orders... Go ahead of the main convoy and essentially find out what they're dealing with. In other words walk out into a field and wait to be shot. He was the sole survivor of a group of 10 men. 7 died instantly before they could even take cover. He sent 2 back to the convoy to save themselves to fight another day, unfortunately they were gunned down in the back (all black as well). He proceeds to single handedly take out a whole German machine gun nest + anti tank gun. As well as take 2 germans hostage and interrogate them in German. Before he was taken to a med center for his multiple gunshot wounds, he stopped and told his commanders exactly where the germans where and what arms they had for several miles. This is no lie... Look it up, a true American hero

And I know its a game and all but to just add women to WWII with the snap of a finger is all fabrication and does nothing to honor or respect the true heroes fought, and sadly way too many did not make it back from this one

Tomorrow i am going to wake up and discover none of this ever happened and games are back to the way they should be.....to provide a fun experience and getaway from the crap we call real life. As a kid gaming was the only thing i had...and now as an adult i am sincerely afraid i am going to lose it because flawed people such as yourself cannot be objective with business and instead would rather use your games as a platform to try to force you own personal ideals onto others. 

Dear EA: keep politics out of gaming, keep feminism out of gaming, keep your ideals out of gaming.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Women actually did serve in wars throughout history, but primarily when they were disguised as men. It would have made sense for her to have dressed up as a man (More face and body coverage) but still have her voice give her away.

Edit: Maybe make her character someone who rarely, if ever, speaks while covered up almost entirely as to not give herself away, then reveal later that she's a woman to the player near the end of the story, have her say something along the lines of: "Please keep this a secret," and just continue the campaign like the scene never happened. It'd have the same amount of inclusion but with more realness by not shoving it in the player's face.

Edit: And when I mean serve, I mean front lines. Ik most women helped by making food, clothing, ammo, and tending to the wounded soldiers.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
I do find the female covergirl a little strange for a WWII game, but BF has been departing steadily from reality anyway. BF 1 was very ridiculous with its choice of weapons. So relatively speaking, it is only as significant as all the characters being blue.

I was really hoping for a more historically representative game (BF 1), because the unique tone and gameplay was appealing. But no, it was all hand-held machine guns and a distinct lack of trenches. Basically an arcade shooter like COD or the new battlefronts. The further they stray from what made the originals great (gameplay freedom, and attempted realism), the fewer people will play.... (even on top of the recent scandals)

If you want a new direction it is better to start a new franchise than to try to funnel old fans in a new direction... and complain they are angry about games not meeting their expectations. Sort term it may work, but long term customers will never trust you to deliver what they want.

Comment:
maybe you shouldnt care about realism but you should care that ea changing history and re-inventing the war stories they talked about to make white men seem more edgy and flawed and women and ethinic minorities better.

No flag, billy bridger. Pure fabrication. The first sbs was roger courtney. He had to prove the sbs was worth the investment during ww2, so he sneaked onto the admirals guarded ship and carved his name into the door. When the sbs was signed off he recuited 'good men' from a base in scotland. He did not recuit criminals, this is an insult to how the sbs was founded and the missions they completed like 'operational angelo' (google this it is an amzing read).

Then we go onto the norway resistance story. No female sniper was involved in the event. British SAS with noweigen snipers hosted a guerrilla war against the germans.

There was one female nurse that went with them. Not a young female sniper at all. This story completly women washed the event.

Next the Senegalese soldiers were never conscripted. They did something braver they volenteered. They werent unfairly sidelined, however, yes, they didnt recieve the same benefits package after the war as their french brothers in arms and most went home.

Now you probably dont care, but ea is brainwashing people with an agenda. An anti white male agenda that makes what our grandparents did a complete laughing stock.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
"OK, so my degree is actually in history with an emphasis on World War 2. They've included women and women had a place during World War 2 no doubt, but their place during the war was working in hospitals, shipyards, and ammunition factories. They weren't on the front lines. I would love to chalk this up to historical stupidity in Silicon Valley, but they've made a statement by putting a woman ON THE COVER. You now have a name that has nothing to do with World War 2 and cover art featuring a woman fighting. We get it, this is 2018 and women are equal. Now there is something that advertising and the design team should understand: people are asking for World War 2 games b/c we're tired of the scifi crap, and those same people want historical accuracy, not political correctness wrapped up in a summer blockbuster movie trailer.

World War 2 is the greatest setting in history. You have wonder weapons, ruthless dictators, true heroes, and some of the greatest battles ever fought. Your cover features NONE of this. Instead we get a metrosexual glow effect and a random woman that we're supposed to care about. It's very hard to mess up World War 2, and you've managed to mess it up in pretty much every way possible." - The Angry Writer. He's right you know?

Comment:
I have a degree in history and I also love to search up facts about ww2. Black people and women did not serve with white males, blacks had their own platoons and women worked in hospitals, shipyards, built ammunition and other stuff to help out in the war. 

The only time women and blacks served was women in the Russian army like "lady death" and blacks together with women in the German army due to desperation of troops after loosing so much, there Asians served as well, they all served next to white males. What you're doing is telling the women that actually served in WW2 that they were useless and have to make up a fictional story to make a statement. this isn't historically accurate, there is no history in this at all other than the time period, even the tanks are wrong, there were tanks made for ramming into buildings, those tanks in the trailer are not right. Also, people are not interested in a blockbuster, Michael Bay- type WW2 experience, that is why cod WW2 failed so miserably, even for mostly accurate history with platoons and other things except for the woman arriving later in the game the game was hated because it wasn't realistic, you're taking everything WW2 did bad and increase it, you have failed miserably and this game will make you less money than you have ever made, you will go back on this.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Well i think there could also be another reason for why people are moving away from battlefield, and for me its not because there is women or they look like something from a steampunk universe. The reason why i have lost interest in the newer battlefield games is because they have started to become to much of an arcade kind of game stile where everything is so much more streamlined and now its all about fast past action, and i am not saying a game like that is wrong but when i started to play it was because i felt that Battlefield was a balance of the action packed and tactical kind of a game.
 While still at the same time you where able to have huge maps that allowed you to do massive flanks, the fact you did not have the vehicle in the spawn menu was also a thing that for me did allot.
And if you look at most of EA games now days they kind of all follow this kind of stream line play style. If you look at the old Battle front for example the map there was usually extremely big, same for Battlefield 2, 3, 1942 and even 2142 (i will admit i did not like this game it felt kind of off.) and all of them kind of played on the fact of the open maps that allows you to make some tactical decisions and can make the game play stay a little more fresh for a longer time.
While the newer ones it feels like you are forced down a corridor (like the old metro map in BF 3 i think it was.) and I think allot of the older players do not like this kind of game style and is kind of moving away towards other games that might be able to go towards that taste.

So all of this is what i think it could be, its not like i got any proof except for why i stopped playing it and have been the reason for some of my friends stopped playing it and there really is no wrong or right way if you want to play a game, its just bugs me that they blame the lack of women or the fact that there is woman in the game most be the reason of why people will be leaving or stop playing it. I kind of gave up on the BF series after BF 1 sense i did not think it portrayed the way of WW 1 combat was like, Allot of trench and dead man land.
Then again who knows this is just what i think but i might be completely wrong and it could be all us evil men that wants to push women down!!! BAD ME, BAD ME!!
To be honest i will not go and buy another battle field game until i think they might move back in that direction of tactical and a little bit of realistic felling... (not fully but just a little bit..... Just the tip xD)

Well If you read all this creed man xD

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
OK, so my degree is actually in history with an emphasis on World War 2. They've included women and women had a place during World War 2 no doubt, but their place during the war was working in hospitals, shipyards, and ammunition factories. They weren't on the front lines. I would love to chalk this up to historical stupidity in Silicon Valley, but they've made a statement by putting a woman ON THE COVER. You now have a name that has nothing to do with World War 2 and cover art featuring a woman fighting. We get it, this is 2018 and women are equal. Now there is something that advertising and the design team should understand: people are asking for World War 2 games b/c we're tired of the scifi crap, and those same people want historical accuracy, not political correctness wrapped up in a summer blockbuster movie trailer.

World War 2 is the greatest setting in history. You have wonder weapons, ruthless dictators, true heroes, and some of the greatest battles ever fought. Your cover features NONE of this. Instead we get a metrosexual glow effect and a random woman that we're supposed to care about. It's very hard to mess up World War 2, and you've managed to mess it up in pretty much every way possible.

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC71uZiXBVao-a3T8LqPZNqg

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
BF4 VS BF5 SplitScreen : https://youtu.be/oI-bP0nqQL4
Battlefield 4 = hands Down a Visceral FPS war Game, the Look,The Feel,The Sounds,the Weapons/the Movements/the Gunplay  >  BF5 a Over Saturated,goofy awkward movements.Guns offset, guns look like plastic toys.
..... /ugh... 
Rewind the clock and set the Engine back to BF4 settings.. these Battlefront/Battlefield 5 settings Look and Feel Horrible...
.... if you showed me the BF5 game and removed anything giving away that it was a DICE battlefield game. I would Honestly think it was a PC game made by some 3rd rate company, it just has no DICE Battlefield qualities to the game.
....  Its a Bland,Generic,Over saturated fast paced FPS.. with a bunch of stupid gimmicky things... (like when you kill a person in BF5 and get some reward = some rediculous visuals mesh on the screen = WTF.... get that crap outa the game.. uggh.. )
.....This side by side comparison really shows how much better BF4 was in everyway. Bf5 is just a plastic turd.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Me = I‚Äôm confused by what this reveal trailer is actually trying to depict to me about this game. It appears on the one hand to be set in a historically correct WW2 environment, however it also has a female character running around with a robotic arm clubbing people to death with a cricket bat. So now I‚Äôm wondering if this a fantasy game set in the future where people have bionic limbs in warfare or is this a WW2 shooter with future bits added in? 

I better look to EA for some official guidance, as I don‚Äôt know if I want to buy this game or not.

EA = This game is historically correct, WW2 had tones of woman in it, if you don‚Äôt like it, don‚Äôt buy it, if you‚Äôre confused by BFV‚Äôs identity your uneducated and also sexist.

Me = O.K I won‚Äôt.

Comment: i see a new trailer has been released everyone looked at the first one and though nope haven't even given it a second thought, but as for constructive criticism the maps are tiny  the snipers are unusable compared to bf1 it has been stupidly nefed and the sniper scopes look really blury down scope snipers in general need fixing the class in not as specialised and playable as it should be.  the stg44 in semi auto has stupid range for assault class and actually needs tuning down abit.    Spawns are messed up maybe due to the tiny maps and poor placing i have been on the beta and put some hours in i found the minute you spawn you either get killed or you catch someone off guard like the grim reaper.   the graphics are good no doubt but battle fields fans dont just play because it looks pretty we play because of substance in games history at its finest. Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
I don't think historical accuracy was what they were shooting for? I mean I think if they want to introduce a character who against all odds made her way into the 1930s and 1940s military to fight against Nazis, then eh maybe. It doesn't really bother me too much. The only thing is, it has to seem naturally implemented. They can't make it seem forced, or else it's just lousy storytelling and overly in-your-face political posturing. Now just going off of this trailer, I really don't think it's too bad. The ending may be a little obnoxious to some, but it doesn't really bother me too much.
As for the prosthesis, it does seem kinda out of place if they're aiming for at least semi historically accurate portrayals of WW2. Maybe they ought to go full-in and just make it a slightly steam-punk alternate ww2. I think that'd actually be a pretty pumpkin world design. Of course, it's a little late in the game for that. Ah well. I think the marketing team and the "uneducated" comment is what really did them in. The game itself doesn't look like it'd be all that bad.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Imo, this is an objectively terrible trailer. 

The beginning action sequences are theatrically unappealing (Jumping out of a house right and landing right in front of (enemy?) tanks? Why? Incredibly jerky camera for "realism"?), and the transition to the FPS perspective is laughable. Shooting down a plane with a few random bullets? Enemies running into your handgun rounds and dying in a few shots? And what was the unarmed guy at the end supposed to do to you? This trailer didn't give me the feeling of a battlefield (Where's the front line? Why are there enemies all around you? Why was the motorbike right next to the tanks? Weren't they enemy tanks? Why was he following the tanks afterwards then?).

And what's the appeal of gunning people down with a character that looks like he can't even stand on his (or her) own two feet properly and fires bullets everywhere randomly? Am I supposed to be impressed by such mediocre playing, or attracted to how the points pop up on my screen every few seconds?

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
*makes it halfway through the trailer*
God, you guys just really gave up on this one, huh? I get the whole changing history thing... except NO. Your core audience is impressionable young kids who will be disappointed that life is unfair (snowflake kids grow up to be snowflake adults), 20 somethings with a college degree (who are not impressed with how many audiences you are trying to pander to) and dads who earned college credits in history to get where they are at. (Change history? Maybe for a movie that my wife would rent with redbox and fall asleep during ~ I'm not gonna pay 60$ for that garbage in a videogame package.
Pro tip: You already lost me at battlefield 1. BF3 and 4 were so decent... so pretty... the frostbite physics were so great... why do you INSIST on doing this? Project lead threaten your job? At what point does nobody EVER speak up against this horrible idea? Does a company stop caring about pleasing their fanbase? And then further... we are talking about these gigantic content creators... DID THEY STOP CARING ABOUT MONEY?!?!?!?
Its like... are you just so completely out of touch with reality?!
The creation process is so insanely simple, you look at the previous games. You look at the complaint section on metacritic/game reviews/steam/forums pages... you fix the bugs, you add the features, you write a narrative, you dodge the memes and you push out a title that nobody feels bad about. As a writer, you just set the narrative, set the stage, make your ending and your creative talent finds out the cool stuff between point 1 and point 100%! And granted, previous battlefields have already hit narrative roadblocks. You found vocal minorities who fall into obscurity, unseen plot twists that were actually super obvious, musical choices that were nice but cliche... and then we have to mention that the graphics and 'cutscenes' of a sort, are nice... but getting extremely heavy handed. Let the player play. Or are we forgetting how extremely few people actually finish the games and only buy it for the multiplayer?
Just shameful. #VoteWithYourWallet

But women aside, this is still so historically inaccurate. WWII is arguably the most important event in history, and especially because it happened so recently compared to other historical tragedies, I think it could almost be a crime to misrepresent this event and then claim that the things that happen in this trailer could've easily happened in WWII. Kids today play more video games today than they watch documentaries so I think it would be so important that we don't rewrite history to what we would've wanted to happen.

A little factfile on women solders: Beginning in December 1941, 350,000 women served in the United States Armed Forces, during WWII. Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
The problem I see here is Battlefield abandoning it's roots to become something else, they are trying to become another Fortnite. I don't have a problem with women being on the frontlines or people with prosthetics fighting, but I can see how many view this as pushing the envelope too far, the fear is they will soon have Battlefield become an entirely different game that has nothing of what made it unique in the first place, my guess is EA trying really hard to make it appeal for the mass audience and for the game to be generic and easy to get into. They might try to introduce cyborgs, ninjas or demons to make it stand out for the next game. The question is: Will these gimmicks increase sales?
They should have left Battlefield alone, it's always a mistake to mess with a well established franchise, they could have taken a risk by making an original game. Instead they used a well established title to experiment, they could have at least created polls or have players suggest what they wanted, it's better to let people vote on what they want in the game.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Women rarely fought on the front lines. And if someone lost a limb they could only do non combat roles which is common knowledge. Although none of this would have been an issue if they didn't tout it as historically accurate. But I guess im not educated enough to know 350.000 women served in the U.S during WW2 compared to the 16 million men. And that most didnt even serve combat roles to begin with.

Even if you take into account the other countries though the number of women will always be dwarfed by the amount of men. And the same trend follows that they mostly did Coms, nursed the innured back to health, and other backstage tasks. A few may have fought like the russian snipers and french resistance but those are the only notable examples. I will say it one more time though... If they didnt say it was historically accurate and a spin off of history instead things would of been fine. But they didnt and now the pre orders have flopped after they called people stupid for not calling it accurate. I personally dont care much and im not great at battle field anyway. But even if I was I still wouldnt buy it after being insulted like that and told not to buy the game. That's alright though, spread the word lf EA's misdeeds and make this game a flop in their eyes. They literally asked for it after all.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Alright, I've been playing devil's advocate and arguing in defense of BFV from a creative license viewpoint, but even I have to admit that this trailer is downright ridiculous. I don't know if you're trying to compete with Call of Duty's "in your face", action packed style of game trailers, but the amount of absurdity and chaos in this trailer defies belief! It's way too over the top, like the final battle of a Michael Bay movie, and without even looking through the rest of the comments, I KNOW FOR A FACT I'm not the first person to say so! This trailer is nonsense. Absolute nonsense.

And didn't the woman with the fake arm get shot and killed at the beginning? Then ten seconds later she's shooting at tanks on her back and WTF is going on?!

Comment:
I showed the reveal trailer to my Great Grandad. A man who fought in D-Day all the way to Okinawa He said...

"Is that a female?"
"Yes grandad"
"Is that face paint?"
"Yes grandad"
"Does she have a prosthetic hand?"
"Yes grandad"

He then took his glasses off as his eyes filled with tears and said...

"I lost so many friends during that war. They weren't ‚Äôfriends‚Äô at all. They were my brothers. And I miss them everyday."

He wiped his tears away and finished by saying...

"I'm sorry, I didnt see any women with claws wearing face paint....but I saw a lot of dead men. Is this what people think happened? Because it isnt."

I patted him on the head and simply told him...

"You're uneducated."
#GetWokeGoBroke

I do not care. Not one bit. About playing as a woman. Mirrors edge, portal, portal 2, and Mass Effect are some of my favorite games. Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
I have no problem with women being in the game, if it's done in a plausible fashion. Zara Ghufran in BF1 was believable, it is documented that during the Arab revolts  Bedouin women fought in combat roles. honestly I don't think we saw it enough of Zara. I would have liked for her story to have continued a little longer. 

The Red Army had women in combat roles. Resistance movements in France, Poland and to some degree Italy saw women in combat roles. women in any of these roles would have been plausible and I doubt there would have been any backlash from it. In Call of Duty finest Hour there was a female sniper in the Russian army named Tanya Pavlovna. I don't remember there being any backlash or any one batting an ey about it back then because it was done plausibly. In Call of Duty 3 there was a French resistance fighter named Isabelle DuFontaine. Her presence didn't bother anybody either because it was believable.

 In the British military there were a total of 60 women recruited by the Special Operations executive. 60 out of 3.5 million. And they were used primarily as spies.  Nevermind the fact that none of them had prosthetic arms. Most Allied countries used women in auxiliary roles as nurses Clerks, typists, truck drivers and auxiliary Pilots. Now don't run away on me with auxiliary Pilots because their primary job was to fly planes from factories in the United States to airfields in Great Britain. They weren't combat personnel.

 Basically what I'm trying to say is if you're going to integrate women into the game I have no problem with it as long as it is done in a plausable fashion that I can believe and it feels organic. Special Forces Commandos with prosthetic arms in the British army are not plausible, they are not believable and they certainly are not an organic integration. EA wouldn't be facing any backlash at all if she had instead been a Russian sniper or a French resistance fighter. Instead they threw all caution to the wind and decided to put them in places where they were not and that was not believable. 

I understand that the game is a work of fiction not a history lesson however the reason that most people I know want to play a game set in World War ll ist to feel like they're actually there during World War II. If you start throwing in female Commandos with prosthetic arms in the British army you destroy all suspension of disbelief. I don't know about everybody else but that's not what I came here for.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment: I love how they're arrogant enough to think that people only don't like the trailer because we're too dumb and bigoted when female characters have been staples in games for many years. No one complained about Metroid, Tomb Raider, Resident Evil, Dino Crisis, Bayonetta, or The Last of Us Part II. No one even batted an eye when EA themselves put Russian women in BF1, which did happen (albeit rarely, but then again most weapons in that game were technically real but also rare so no one really complained). What they don't understand is that this has been completely and obviously shoe-horned in only for the sake of shoe-horning it in to make a point. No one would have even complained if they included women resistance fighters and Russian women in this game, but making a British womyn with one arm on the frontlines with a cricket bat the centerpiece for your WW2 game just screams "We're doing this to make a point you misogynistic gamers" and quite frankly we don't like to be insulted in that way. Add on top of that a literal insult and a plea not to buy your game, and there you have it. Well played, EA.

Comment:
Had well over a thousand hours on bf3, one of my favourite games as a kid. I used to say playing that game "imagine a world war two version of this, it would be amazing" you can only imagine my immense childish giddiness when i heard this was being released, followed by overwhelming disappointment upon seeing it. What a disgrace to all the men who fought and who died in that war. You should be ashamed of yourselves. Its not "your take on history" its what you want people to believe was history so the younger generations believe your politics. Blatant propaganda and blatant disrespect to your fans and every soldier in world war two on every side. Just pathetic. 
I would have played the living hell out of this game but you dance on the graves of every veteran who fell during or after the war with this "portrayal" of ww2...and thats on top of the micro transactions (aka. Selling the game in as little chunks as possible, piece by piece for inflated prices, squeezing your fan base dry). I'm not buying your game just like i didn't buy your "portrayal" of ww1. Which might as well have been ww2 with the game play. 
Glad your pre orders have dropped and glad your investors convinced you to sack that pandering beta male that ruined star wars (which i also didnt buy) and now this. Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment: To address all the people complaining about no women having fought on the front lines of WW2. The resistance forces in all occupied nations that fought back used anyone that would help in any capacity. The OSS and MI5 regularly used women to spy and move key information across enemy territory and the front and the Russians also used female snipers. So to say Women did not fight in any front is a insult to history. People need to do some research and think critically before they get all butt hurt.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
READ TILL THE END

Dear Battlefield,

I don't recognize you anymore. I was on your side since BF1942. It's sad to see how the community treats this game. Where is your moral? Where is all the hype you used to create? Where is all the excitement you used to spark amongst your true fans.

I still remember the old days. The countless LAN parties, the guided TV missiles, the roads of Dalian Plant, Wake Island, Strike at Karkand etc. These words echoing in my head "Shame, you come to our country to murder us yet, we are the terrorists?".

I truly hope you recover from this. There is only one way to do so. Bring us Bad Company 3.

A disappointed veteran,
DROIDTSUENIK9

Comment:
im a 30ish  year old man... i saw this trailer when it originally came out, I've played all other battlefields. it wasn't until i hear all the negative backlash regarding the lead that i found myself listening to all these people complain about she being a female or what not. After watching the trailer i was only intrigued and confused about one thing. hook arm? is this steam punk? i mean it would be cool if it did because, everyone and their mother has done Ww1 and WW2 and all the other potential world wars, steam punk would actually be new and interesting. i had 0 effs given whether it was a guy or a girl in the screen. in Battlefield 1 there where also women in the game too, and it  didn't take me out of immersion. in hindsight, I'm thinking, if this is the biggest thing you have to complain about, arent you nit picking at this point? i rather worry about micro transactions or glitches or even incomplete dlcs. People on both sides of the isle are in pain of sorts, each side calling each other demons, social justice warriors, and bigots and sexist. it doesnt matter in then its just a game, that you will play for 1.5 years or so, and then move on. why are you all wasting so much energy and negative energy on something that really will not impact your life in anyway shape or form?  i think this is just a symptom of a larger problem. people project emotions that they cant express in normal ways. we see whats been happening on the TV lately with rape allegations and other events and it changes us. most of us say," thats not what men do" others spur into action and rally a cause to defense. 

in the end i think this is just blown out of proportion. i think most of us are so comfortable in our lifes we have no ralling cause for this generation, looking for something to give meaning to us as a generation. like the soldier that comes for war, to an eerie calm. he cant stand it and wishes to go back.

Long rant set aside, i read some people say battlefield 5 is supposed to be a simulation, and that got me thinking. a perfect simulation would be one where you play as a soldier, and if you die....thats it. you have to start from the beginning, and the game gives you a different name each time, and the progression is different every time, no two stories start or end the same. everything unexpect, no way to predict the future from youtube videos or walkthroughs. a challenge for all challenges. i honestly would pay 70 bucks for that.

It's blatantly pandering to the current social climate, and is offensive to those who served. If you're going to to do a realistic, immersive WWII experience, whether it be a videogame or a movie, you don't do this. It's gross.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Women or not... this doesn't look like World War II. This doesn't look like a tactical shooter Battlefield was. Regardless of how the game plays, this trailer is just stupid as it seems to be directed at everyone EXCEPT the core player base of Battlefield games. Add to that release date being in between two monster-sized games, EA insulting disappointed fans and overall falling confidence in EA as a publisher with each anti-consumer move they make and "pre-orders are weak". You just had to keep on pushing and you didn't expect people to push back, eh? 

I'll be honest, I don't care if you add women to the game, that's the last thing on my mind. The reason I don't intend to buy this game is different and build from two issues:
1. You've already broken my immersion by showing how far you want to go with your new customisation mechanic. This is supposed to be a tactical shooter, not a fashion show. Thanks to that I don't think I'd be able to tell who's on what team and what class is the opponent or friendly next to me playing as. That's a fundamental part of a tactical shooter like Battlefield used to be, removed. Probably to cater to the Battle Royale crowd you want to come from Fortnite, what with their silly skins and whatnot. 
2. Lootboxes, microtransactions and other such garbage... That's nowadays, unfortunately, what we came to expect, but with EA it just might turn out to be a nightmare I'd rather not relive.

Comment: First: when you are selling a game about WW2 then you should stick to it otherwise it's false advertising. Luckily for you i feel customers are too used to this kind of behavior and always give it a pass. But beside that the question i ask, not just in videogames but also in movies is why, why companies think people need to see a character like them to be represented? We fought so hard to achieve equality and then i heard the producer of Star Wars saying that before this new trilogy the franchise was a "men franchise", she said Star Wars wasn't for women (what?) so i guess the same ideology applies to Battlefield...The truth is you don't care about social issues, you do this just to be seen as good guys while trying to sell more games to a broader audience but I've got a news, girls play less videogames than guys not because they're not represented and actually there are a lot of girls who love Star Wars. You know who their favorite character is? The character who they feel more attached to? Luke Skywalker! But wait he's a white man so following this stupid, stupid ideology that should not make sense...right? It's clear to me that despite a small proportion (trolls, ecc...) most people critized Battlefield V not because women are in it but because as seen in the trailer it made no sense, it was incoherent and silly. GOOD CHARACTERS and a COHERENT STORY it's what always mattered the most in fictional media and on the contrary It seems that all you care about is diversity but for all the wrong reasons; as you put it before what should be the priority.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment: I'm fine with a woman being in the fight if it's part of the campaign because there were some women who fought in WW2 (even if the number was tiny) because in the campaign it can focus on that specific person's story. I don't like the fact that she's an amputee because they would almost never have let her or anyone re join after the loss of a limb let alone return to active duty on the front lines. This all breaks the realism. My problem (other than that she is an amputee in WW2) is that women shouldn't be playable characters in the multiplayer as it breaks the realism even more because the proportion of men to women in WW2 was something like 1000000 to 1 whereas now in the game the absolute minimum (with at least one woman) is about 64 to 1. That's a big difference. My main concern seems to be the developers giving to game journalism and SJW bull without thinking of what the players want and like. A partial reason why I wanted to play BF1 was that for the most part, it offered a realistic experience whilst still retaining enough videogamey stuff to stay as y'know, a videogame. (Although I would have appreciated a fair few less automatic weapons). Now there is less and less realism along with the company seemingly complying with SJWs as well as the awful new spotting system. I may be giving this one a miss.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Battlefield 1942 = Excellent
Battlefield 1943 = Pretty good
Battlefield 2 = Excellent
Battlefield Vietnam = Excellent
Battlefield 2142 = Beyond excellent, truly unique
Battlefield Bad Company 1 & 2 = Pretty good
Battlefield 3 = It was fun but not the normal Battlefield
Battlefield 4 = It's ok
Battlefield Hardline = [never played it, neat concept though]
Battlefield 5 = Never played it, but they're introducing feminism into a shooter game to appeal to the 'minorities' while rejecting the majority of their fanbase. Women were in WW2, and this woman is British so we'll go with how the Brits did it, the women stayed back in their country on base being nurses & protect their land by being roles such as AntiAir. They were not active duty being deployed out, I also highly doubt a woman would be wearing that badass of a uniform and have a prosthetic limb be that functional (we can't even do that well today). It makes no sense and was a sad attempt into introducing women into games. It would've done a lot better if you had a war where women were actively in, and have the option to choose between a male and female character and keep the main characters men like it has always been. If you insist on making the main character female which is fine, at least make it reasonable and not forced like this one. Make them really fit into the story, and honestly preferably based off a real scenario.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment: The historical inaccuracies are absolutely ridiculous. Submachine guns in BF1 was pushing it, but now we have women on the front lines in the British military in WWII, British soldiers wielding katanas,  advanced prostetics in WWII, no military uniforms in WWII, steam punk looking uniforms in WWII, soldiers without limbs being allowed to continue fighting in WWII, etc. This game tries to shove a political agenda down your throat, and besides that is historically inaccurate in many other ways. On top of that, the devs attacking fans, manipulating comments, etc. is nothing short of disgusting. Before you call me a racist, intolerant sexist, I'm moderate left leaning, support equality and anyone of any gender, and am fine with women, transgenders, and homosexuals in a modern era game. However, having these things in a WWII shooter and calling it immersive and historically accurate is making it extremely political, and it's even worse when you say that you are on the right side of history by modifying history. This game is absolute trash, and I will not buy Battlefield this year. EA, I will continue to boycott your games. #boycott #notmybattlefield

Comment: Ignoring the fact that females did not serve in Combat Arms within the British Army, The risk of letting an amputee (Regardless of gender)  into an Infantry line squad in World War 2 is both tactically and historically inaccurate....It would of never happened. As a Sgt in the Army, I can tell you from personal experience that soldier would of never returned to the front line. The tactical liability created by allowing that soldier to return to duty is not only an endangerment to my mission but more importantly to my men....A conflict in which millions of brave men and women died is not a place to push your agenda whatever that may be. If you wanted to highlight the war fighting contribution that females made in WW2 look towards the Russian Army and the French Resistance, there‚Äôs numerous REAL life examples to draw from. But female amputees assaulting an objective is not one of them....

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
Man....I just watched the BF1 trailer (for like the 50th time) and played the game for a while. Then I watch this and think, "Did I just click a Call of Duty Trailer?" Because that's what this trailer feels like. The graphics obviously look Frostbite-gorgeous, the gameplay looks interesting and is full of sweet WW2 stuff, but they have to go and ruin it by filling it with a bunch of nonsensical female/ethnic characters. 

BF1's trailer epitomized what most fans wanted. The music, visuals, concept, and gameplay are all stunning. Still gives me goosebumps from watching it. This trailer just made me feel kind of sad. They went from the top of the world with a stellar game to a trailer as disheartening as Infinite Warfare.

Title: Battlefield 5 Official Reveal Trailer
Comment:
My personal view on this game is that it looks good HOWEVER I think that adding a, quote ‚Äúbadass woman‚Äù to this game was a stupid decision that is historically inaccurate and there is the argument that there were women in the war and I won‚Äôt take that away from them however there is 2 problems with that first is there were less women in the war second is that they mostly had medical roles in the war but there were a lot of assault female units in Russia because they were desperate and just  let anyone who wanted to sign up and could hold a rifle sign up so what I think would be a great idea is if the only female characters in the game were medics and Russian women an that would make the game historically accurate and include women.
But where I really have a problem is soderlunds speech in which he called everyone who disagreed with his and the developers views uneducated (stupid) and basically said if u don‚Äôt like what we did then either deal with it or don‚Äôt buy the game  which I think is unacceptable when talking to long term fans of the series. But anyway based on the 448k dislikes on this trailer I think a lot of people won‚Äôt be buying it and going for soderlunds second option ( what I will be doing) which if all 448k people do will mean EA will be losing out on 26,880,000$ presuming all of those people would‚Äôve bought it at retail. 
I would‚Äôve bought this game anyways if not for that speech but I think now I will just go for black ops IIII unless there are some major changes in the game and EA apologize.
Hope the investors will be happy EA when one of your top men tells 448k people not to buy the game.
#boycott
